page.title: 16Churches
page.content: There is only one church of any size in our area.That is All Saints' in Hesketh Bank.This was founded over four hundred years ago although not on its present site . It sits between the rectory and the village hall.The burial ground is some distance away ,by a derelict chapel close to the River Douglas boatyard.The Church has a War Memorial with the names of sixteen local men killed in the two World Wars on it. By looking round the burial ground we noticed that one of the most common family names in the Hesketh Bank area seems to be Iddon. There are a number of Primitive Methodist Chapels in our area. These were built in the late 19th century, some with bricks from Longton Brickcroft.(Sally Nightingale and Michael Yeowart)
